intro: Didymocarpus heucherifolius var. heucherifolius, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, featuring broad, waxy leaves that are often a deep green color. The plant produces clusters of vibrant red or orange tubular flowers, which are characteristic of the Bignoniaceae family. Its foliage is often used in ornamental gardening due to its striking appearance and resilience. The plant thrives in full sun to partial shade and is adapted to well-drained soils.
